skill.name: backend-fastapi
skill.description: Documentation for the FastAPI backend, endpoints, and dependency injection.
skill.summary: Documentation for the FastAPI backend, endpoints, and dependency injection.
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The SKILL.md file describes FastAPI backend architecture without any scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. All 40 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting documentation text as code patterns.

content.value_statement: This skill provides documentation about the FastAPI backend powering the chatbot and RAG features. It covers endpoint specifications, environment configuration, and dependency injection patterns for developers building or maintaining backend services.
actual_capabilities: Explains the POST /api/chat endpoint for RAG conversations
Documents the POST /api/ask-selection endpoint for targeted Q&A
Details backend entry point and startup commands
Covers utils and helper modules for embeddings and prompts
limitations: Does not generate or modify backend code
Does not execute or test API endpoints
Cannot debug or troubleshoot backend issues
Does not manage database or vector store connections

use_cases.title: Understand Endpoint Flow
use_cases.description: Learn how chat requests flow through embeddings, vector search, and LLM generation

use_cases.title: Integrate with RAG Pipeline
use_cases.description: Connect AI assistants to the backend for retrieval-augmented generation capabilities

use_cases.title: Configure Backend Services
use_cases.description: Set up environment variables and understand service dependencies for deployment

prompt_templates.title: Endpoint Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: What endpoints does the FastAPI backend expose and what do they do?

prompt_templates.title: Chat Endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the POST /api/chat endpoint and its processing steps

prompt_templates.title: Environment Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: What environment variables are required to run the FastAPI backend?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Deep Dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe the backend architecture including models, utils, and main entry point

output_examples.input: What endpoints does the FastAPI backend expose?
output: • POST /api/chat - Main RAG chat endpoint that embeds queries, searches Qdrant, builds prompts, and generates responses
• POST /api/ask-selection - Targeted Q&A endpoint for questions about selected text

output_examples.input: How does the RAG chat endpoint work?
output: 1. Embed the user query using the configured embedding model
2. Search the Qdrant vector database for similar documents
3. Build a RAG prompt with retrieved context
4. Generate a response using the LLM (Gemini)

best_practices: Use the /api/chat endpoint for general conversation with RAG context
Use /api/ask-selection when users select specific text for targeted questions
Ensure QDRANT_URL and QDRANT_API_KEY are configured before starting the backend
anti_patterns: Calling backend endpoints without proper authentication tokens
Skipping vector store configuration when deploying to production
Using the wrong API key type for embedding versus generation

faq.question: What tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for exploring backend documentation.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the API endpoints?
faq.answer: Rate limits are not defined in the documentation. Check the actual backend implementation for limits.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other Python frameworks?
faq.answer: The documentation is specific to FastAPI. Other frameworks require separate documentation.

faq.question: Is my chat data stored or sent to external services?
faq.answer: The backend uses GEMINI_API_KEY for LLM calls and Qdrant for vector storage. Data handling depends on your configuration.

faq.question: Why is my backend not starting?
faq.answer: Verify GEMINI_API_KEY, QDRANT_URL, and QDRANT_API_KEY are set. Check that port 8000 is available.

faq.question: How does this compare to other backend frameworks?
faq.answer: This FastAPI backend is optimized for RAG workloads with vector search. It differs from Flask/Django in async support.
